item.title: Infosys Postpones Salary Hikes; Know IT Company's Plan On Pay Increment - News18
item.description:
Infosys Postpones Salary Hikes; Know IT Company's Plan On Pay Increment

Date: January 06, 2025 Source: News18

Infosys, India’s second-largest IT services company, has decided to postpone its annual salary hikes to the fourth quarter of FY25 due to ongoing challenges in the global market.

  • The previous salary revisions occurred in November 2023.
  • Some increments will take effect in January, with others in April 2025.
  • Major IT players like HCLTech and LTIMindtree are also deferring pay raises to maintain profitability.
  • Infosys reported a 2.2% sequential increase in net profit but fell short of market expectations.
  • Project Maximus aims to enhance operational profitability and is crucial for margin management.
“Despite the absence of immediate pay revisions, analysts predict the company’s margins may face pressure in the December quarter.”

The postponement of salary hikes highlights the significant impact of macroeconomic factors on the IT sector, with many employees viewing job retention as a major advantage in the current economic climate.

item.title: ITC Demerger: Analysts remain optimistic amid strategic restructuring, see up to 29% upside potential in shares | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
ITC Demerger: Analysts remain optimistic amid strategic restructuring, see up to 29% upside potential in shares

Date: January 6, 2025   Source: Live Mint

The Indian conglomerate ITC has initiated the separation of its hotel business, with shares now trading ex-demerger. This strategic move aims to unlock value for shareholders, and analysts are projecting significant upside in ITC shares.

Key Points:

  • Demerger Ratio: Shareholders will receive one ITC Hotels share for every ten ITC shares held.
  • Index Impact: ITC Hotels will become part of the Nifty 50 and the Sensex.
  • Stock Price Adjustments: ITC shares adjusted to ₹455.60 on the NSE post-demerger.
  • Financial Strength: ITC Hotels starts with ₹1,500 crore in cash.
  • Strategic Initiatives: The company plans major expansions and hotel openings in the coming years.

Notable Quotes:

“The demerger is a significant strategic step, positioning ITC Hotels as an independent hospitality player.”

Analysts expect the demerger to enhance return ratios and improve ITC's overall performance.

B&K Securities has projected a fair value of ₹145 for ITC Hotels, while Centrum Broking set a price target of ₹583, highlighting the benefits of the reorganization.

Conclusion:

The demerger marks an important milestone for ITC, allowing a sharper focus on its core hospitality business and presenting a strong growth outlook.

item.title: Stock market crash: Tata Technologies along with 2 other stocks hit 52-week low; here’s why - Upstox
item.description:
Stock market crash: Tata Technologies along with 2 other stocks hit 52-week low; here’s why

Date: January 6, 2025   Source: National Stock Exchange of India

As many as 77 securities hit their 52-week low levels on the National Stock Exchange of India (NSE) on January 6, with key benchmarks declining amid investor caution over domestic and global uncertainties.

The broader markets traded in the red, with significant declines noticed in the NIFTY50 and BSE SENSEX indices, while the volatility index, India VIX, surged.

  • Benchmark NIFTY50 index at 23,665, down 339 points (1.41%).
  • BSE SENSEX down 1164 points (1.47%).
  • Rising cases of Human Metapneumovirus impacting market sentiment.
  • Foreign investors net selling seen with an outflow of over ₹4,500 crore.
  • Companies Tata Technologies, Bandhan Bank, and IndiaMART InterMESH hit their 52-week lows.
“Tata Technologies is expected to gain momentum with upcoming deals from BMW and Agratas.”

Investors are advised to keep an eye on the unfolding situations and market conditions as predictions vary amidst ongoing economic challenges.

item.title: Stock Market Live: Sensex Falls 1,200 Points, Nifty Drops To 23,600 In Broad Selloff; Nifty IT Bucks Trend - NDTV Profit
item.description:
Stock Market Live: Sensex Falls 1,200 Points, Nifty Drops To 23,600 In Broad Selloff; Nifty IT Bucks Trend

Published on: 01:53 PM | Source: NDTV Profit

The Indian stock market has undergone a major selloff, with the NSE Nifty and the BSE Sensex experiencing a notable decline of over 1.6%. As investors reacted to economic concerns, the Indian rupee hit a record low against the US dollar.

  • The Nifty 50 was down around 10% from its 52-week high.
  • Key sectors such as IT remained resilient during the downturn.
  • The Indian rupee reached an all-time low of 85.846 against the US dollar.
  • The selloff was largely attributed to economic apprehensions and significant points losses in major sectors.
“Nifty IT index is the sole sectoral holdout in today's selloff.”

The selloff reflects heightened market volatility and concerns over economic indicators. Investors are advised to stay informed on market movements and factors influencing them.

item.title: Hyundai Creta Electric to get Level 2 ADAS, more power than Creta N-Line: Details - The Times of India
item.description:
Hyundai Creta Electric to get Level 2 ADAS, more power than Creta N-Line: Details

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

The upcoming Hyundai Creta Electric is set to include advanced Level 2 ADAS capabilities and will offer more power compared to the Creta N-Line model.

  • The Hyundai Creta Electric will be equipped with Level 2 Advanced Driver Assistance Systems (ADAS).
  • This model promises to deliver greater power output than the conventional Creta N-Line.
  • Features and specifications have not been fully disclosed yet.
  • Market release is anticipated in late 2023.
“Hyundai is committed to enhancing the driving experience with new technology integrations.”

This innovation reflects Hyundai's progress in electric mobility, prioritizing both safety and performance.

item.title: Kotak Mahindra Bank, Devyani International, UCO Bank, ITC, Dabur, Marico, Nykaa: Check top buzzing stocks of the day - Upstox
item.description:
Top Buzzing Stocks of the Day: January 6, 2025

Date: January 6, 2025

Source: Upstox

The stock market experienced significant declines on January 6, 2025, with key indices falling over 1% amid broad selling. Here are some stocks that were particularly active in today's trading session.

  • ITC: Trading at ₹448.30 after a pre-open session consolidating price for its hotel unit demerger.
  • UCO Bank: Down 3.63% at ₹43.33, reporting strong year-on-year growth.
  • Kotak Mahindra Bank: Shares down 3.15% after COO announced resignation.
  • NTPC Green Energy: Trading down 1.6% at ₹126.30 post-contract win announcement.
  • Dabur India: Shares fell 3.25% after its Q3 business update predicted low growth.
  • Marico: Trading down 1.81% amidst inflationary pressures.
  • Devyani International: Shares up nearly 9% as it holds major franchise rights.
  • Easy Trip Planners: Stock jumped over 17% after chairman's statement on stake holding.
  • Jubilant FoodWorks: Shares hit a 52-week high, up 4.9% post strong Q3 revenue announcement.
  • RBL Bank: Increased by 4% with healthy growth reported in gross advances.
  • Titan Company: Shares rose 1.7% following growth in standalone revenue.
  • Nykaa: Trading nearly 5% higher with strong quarterly performance.

item.title: Hyundai Creta Electric Interior Revealed, Top Features Announced - CarDekho
item.description:
Hyundai Creta Electric Interior Revealed, Top Features Announced

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: CarDekho.com

Hyundai has unveiled the interior of the all-electric Creta Electric, showcasing its dashboard layout that closely resembles its ICE-powered counterpart but with several enhancements.

  • Similar dashboard layout as the ICE model with some tweaks.
  • New three-spoke steering wheel and black and white cabin theme with purple ambient lighting.
  • Features include dual 10.25-inch displays, Bose sound system, and panoramic sunroof.
  • Safety features include six airbags and Level-2 ADAS.
  • Available in Standard Range (135 PS) and Long Range (171 PS) versions.
  • Prices to be announced on January 17 at Auto Expo 2025.
"Hyundai India has given us a first look at the upcoming Creta Electric’s interior ahead of its launch on January 17 at the Auto Expo 2025."

The Hyundai Creta Electric appears to be packed with features, targeting modern consumers while attempting to set a benchmark in the electric SUV market.

item.title: Quadrant Future Tek IPO: 10 key points to consider before ₹290 crore offer opening - Upstox
item.description:
Quadrant Future Tek IPO: 10 Key Points to Consider Before ₹290 Crore Offer Opening

Publication Date: January 7, 2025

Source: Upstox

The initial public offering of Quadrant Future Tek is set to open on January 7, 2025, with a price band of ₹275-₹290 per share. This summary highlights ten important points for potential investors.

  • Subscription Period: The share sale will be open from January 7 to January 9.
  • Anchor Investors' Bidding: Anchor bidding takes place on January 6.
  • Offer Structure: The ₹290 crore offer is a fresh issue of one crore equity shares with no offer for sale.
  • Price Band: Set between ₹275 to ₹290 per share.
  • Reservation: 75% for qualified institutional buyers, 10% for retail investors, and 15% for non-institutional investors.
  • Lot Size: Retail investors can apply for 50 shares at a minimum investment of ₹14,500.
  • Use of Proceeds: Funds will be used for working capital, capital expenditures, debt clearing, and corporate purposes.
  • Lead Manager and Registrar: Sundae Capital Advisors (manager) and Link Intime India (registrar).
  • Allotment Date: Likely finalised on January 10.
  • Listing Date: Shares will list on January 14.

Quadrant Future Tek is engaged in developing advanced train control and signalling systems for Indian Railways.

Financials

ParticularsFY22FY23FY24H1FY25
Revenue₹104.25 cr₹152.8 cr₹151.75 cr₹65.13 cr
Net Profit₹1.94 cr₹13.90 cr₹14.71 cr-₹12.10 cr

item.title: Maruti Got Biggest Shock Before Auto Expo! - MotorOctane
item.description:
Tata Punch Tops Sales Chart, Ends Maruti's 40-Year Dominance

Publication Date: January 5, 2025 | Source: MotorOctane

The Indian auto industry has witnessed a significant change in 2024 as Tata Punch becomes the best-selling car of the year, marking the first time in 40 years that a Maruti model is not at the top.

  • Tata Punch sold over 2.02 lakh units in 2024, surpassing Maruti's WagonR, which sold 1.91 lakh units.
  • Three out of the top five selling cars in India are SUVs, reflecting the growing SUV culture.
  • The Punch is celebrated for its robust design, safety features, and affordability.
Tata Punch edged out Maruti’s previous champions WagonR and Swift to become India’s best-selling car in 2024.

The shift in auto sales highlights changing consumer preferences and increasing competition in the Indian automobile market.

item.title: Markets extend losses: NIFTY50 and SENSEX fall over 1%, HDFC Bank, Kotak Bank and Reliance among top index movers - Upstox
item.description:
Markets extend losses: NIFTY50 and SENSEX fall over 1%, HDFC Bank, Kotak Bank and Reliance among top index movers

Date: January 6, 2023 | Source: Financial News

Indian equity benchmarks extended morning losses in the mid-market session, with foreign portfolio investors continuing their selling spree as traders awaited Q3 earnings season cues.

The main points highlighted in this article include:

  • Foreign institutional investors sold ₹4,227.25 crore in capital markets on Friday.
  • SENSEX traded down by 0.95% at 78530.57, while NIFTY50 fell 1.01% to 23764.85.
  • The broader indices were also in decline; BSE mid-cap down 1.27%, small-cap down 1.64%.
  • HDFC Bank shares dropped due to slowed credit growth updates.
  • Titan shares rallied over 2% backed by strong Q3FY25 growth, with a 24% YoY revenue increase.
  • Asian markets mostly traded in the red, with some noteworthy declines in major indices.
“Investors are wary of taking on more risk in light of looming US-China trade tensions.”

This article provides insight into the cautious sentiment prevailing in the Indian stock markets, primarily driven by foreign selling and awaiting the upcoming earnings reports.

item.title: Titan Q3 update: Jewellery segment grows 26% YoY on strong festive demand; CaratLane surges 25% - Upstox
item.description:
Titan Q3 Update: Jewellery Segment Grows 26% YoY on Strong Festive Demand; CaratLane Surges 25%

Date: January 6, 2025 | Source: Titan Company

Titan Company has reported a strong Q3 business update, with significant growth across its jewellery and CaratLane segments driven by festive demand.

  • Standalone revenue increased by 24% YoY in Q3FY25.
  • The jewellery segment grew by 26% YoY, aided by a strong festive season.
  • CaratLane experienced a growth of 25% YoY.
  • Gold coin sales surged by 48% YoY, reflecting consumer preference for gold investments.
  • The overall retail network expanded by 69 stores, reaching a total of 3,240 stores.
“Caratlane grew c. 25% YoY, driven by a strong c. 26% YoY growth in the studded portfolio. Buyers grew c. 8% YoY...”

In conclusion, Titan's robust performance in Q3 highlights the company's resilience and growth potential, particularly in the jewellery and e-commerce sectors.

item.title: Meta moves NCLAT against ₹213.14 crore CCI penalty over WhatsApp privacy policy - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Meta Appeals ₹213.14 Crore CCI Penalty Over WhatsApp Privacy Policy

Published on: 06 Jan 2025, 5:53 am

Meta Platforms Inc has filed an appeal with the NCLAT against a ₹213.14 crore penalty imposed by the CCI for abuses related to its WhatsApp privacy policy.

  1. Meta is contesting a CCI penalty regarding its WhatsApp privacy policy.
  2. The penalty amounts to ₹213.14 crore for abusing market dominance.
  3. Senior Advocates Kapil Sibal and Mukul Rohatgi are representing Meta and WhatsApp.
  4. The NCLAT is set to hear the case on January 16.
  5. The CCI found that WhatsApp's 2021 policy violated the Competition Act.
  6. Citing a 'take-it-or-leave-it' approach, the CCI deemed user autonomy undermined.

“The order has huge implications. We request your lordships to take it up yourself.”

In conclusion, the outcome of this case may have significant ramifications for WhatsApp and the broader tech industry regarding data sharing practices.

item.title: Stock market crash: Sensex cracks 1200 points, Nifty 50 below 23,700; HMPV virus scare among 5 factors behind selloff | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Stock market crash: Sensex cracks 1200 points, Nifty 50 below 23,700; HMPV virus scare among 5 factors behind selloff

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Live Mint

The Indian stock market witnessed a significant crash on Monday, with both Sensex and Nifty 50 indices falling over a percent due to investor fears sparked by a new virus outbreak in China. The Sensex dropped over 1,100 points, while Nifty 50 slipped below the 23,700 mark.

  • Sectoral indices, including Nifty PSU Bank and Nifty Realty, experienced major losses.
  • Top losers included Tata Steel, BPCL, and Adani Enterprises.
  • The fall attributed to weak Asian markets, a virus outbreak, heavy losses in index heavyweights, strength of the US dollar, and broken technical support levels.
“Nifty holds a good view until it stays above its 200 DMA which is placed at 23,900.” - Prashanth Tapse, Senior VP (Research), Mehta Equities Ltd.

Analysts suggest caution as the market reacts to geopolitical uncertainties and technical resistance levels.

item.title: Supreme Court transfers Amazon, Flipkart cases to Karnataka High Court on CCI plea - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Supreme Court Transfers Amazon, Flipkart Cases to Karnataka High Court

Publication Date: January 2, 2024

Source: Bar and Bench

The Supreme Court has transferred all cases against e-commerce giants Amazon and Flipkart to the Karnataka High Court, in response to a plea from the Competition Commission of India (CCI).

  • The Supreme Court ruled that the cases are to be consolidated and heard in Karnataka.
  • The court noted that the transfer is appropriate due to overlapping issues with ongoing cases in that jurisdiction.
  • The CCI filed the plea to expedite the legal process and minimize conflicting rulings.
  • 24 petitions concerning alleged anti-competitive practices by Amazon and Flipkart are currently pending.
  • Allegations include violations of the Competition Act, 2002 regarding exclusive deals and deep discounts.
“The issue involved in the subject matter of this transfer petition is substantially seen as the issue involved in the Writ Petition no. 26627 of 2024...it will be appropriate if all the petitions are transferred for hearing to the High Court of Karnataka.” — Justice Abhay S Oka

The Supreme Court has indicated that the matter will return to the bench on January 6, awaiting full consideration of all parties involved.

item.title: Sensex Bull Case at 1,05,000 by December 2025 for Morgan Stanley; focus list shares upside up to 50% - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Morgan Stanley Projects Sensex to Reach 1,05,000 by December 2025

Date: Recent Report | Source: CNBC TV18

Morgan Stanley forecasts a bull case scenario for the BSE Sensex to reach 1,05,000 by the end of December 2025, implicating a potential upside of up to 50% for its focus stocks.

  • The bull case has a 30% probability of materializing.
  • Key conditions include stable oil prices below $70/barrel and supportive government reforms.
  • 10 focus stocks from Maruti, Trent, Reliance Industries, among others, are highlighted for their upward potential.
  • The base case scenario posits a target of 93,000 for the Sensex with a 50% likelihood.
  • The bear case expects a drop to 70,000 given unfavorable economic conditions.
"Morgan Stanley is 'Overweight' on sectors like financials, consumer discretionary, industrials and technology stocks."

Overall, Morgan Stanley presents a bullish outlook on India's stock market, notably for sectors poised for significant growth.

item.title: ITC shares now trade ex-hotels; Check stock price post demerger - CNBCTV18
item.description:
ITC Shares Trade Ex-Hotels; Current Stock Price Adjusted Post-Demerger

Date: Jan 6, 2025

Source: CNBC TV18

ITC Ltd's market price has been set at ₹455.60 following a special trading session as its hotels arm separates from the conglomerate, which includes cigarette and FMCG businesses.

The company’s stock opened at ₹26 lower, reflecting the expected adjustment for the hotel business as listings for ITC Hotels are anticipated by mid-February. Shareholders will receive an equity share of ITC Hotels for every 10 shares of ITC held post-demerger.

  • Market assigned ITC shares a price of ₹455.60 on January 6, 2025.
  • Shares opened ₹26 lower than the previous close after the company went ex-hotel business.
  • Shareholders will receive one share of ITC Hotels for every 10 shares held.
  • Analysts expect a listing price for ITC Hotels between ₹100-125.
  • SBI Securities predicts a net profit of ₹546 crore for ITC Hotels in FY 2025.
  • ITC Hotels aims to expand to over 200 hotels by 2030.
“We are expecting the listing to be on or before Feb 2025...” - Prashanth Tapse, Mehta Equities

The demerger is expected to enhance shareholder value and strengthen the focus on the luxury hospitality sector. Investors are encouraged to hold onto their shares to benefit from this transition.
